intro: Pleurothallis serricardia, commonly known as the serrated pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It is known for its intricate floral structure and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
